result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy Jacob Marker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Monies due shall be paid at $50.00 per month commencing September 1, 2022; if payments are not made timely, judgment shall be entered. Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered.
There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Prosecuting Attorney Elizabeth A. Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Timothy Jacob Marker in court and by Attorney Michelle A. Wenninger.  Resolution reached with global offer on 22CF44 & 22CM106.  Atty. Wenninger to file an updated plea questionnaire following hearing that has the signature of defendant/counsel.  State moves to amend charge to reflect Misd. Hit and Run No Injury pursuant to sec. 346.67(1) and 346.74(5)(a) and Court so orders.  State to file an amended Information.  No contest plea entered on Ct. 1 as amended.  Court finds defendant guilty on Ct. 1 as amended.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
